intro: Ardisia squarrosa, commonly known as the squarrosa beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, including regions such as Indonesia, Malaysia, and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that appear in the summer. Following flowering, it produces bright red berries that are a striking feature of the plant. These berries are not only ornamental but also serve as a food source for various birds and small mammals.
